summary: This is an internal email update from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York summarizing key meetings and contacts from the week of July 29 to August 1, 2019, regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It details meetings with Epstein's defense team, an assistant's counsel, and multiple victims, discussing potential cooperation and gathering evidence of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation; his attorneys discussed potential resolution or cooperation, and multiple victims describe being sexually assaulted and raped by him.

persons.name: NW MM
persons.context: Identified as one of Epstein's assistants in New York who scheduled travel for a victim to Epstein's properties.

connections.description: NW MM is identified as one of Epstein's assistants who scheduled travel for victims to his properties.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein's Attorneys
events.description: The prosecution team met with Epstein's attorneys, who discussed in general terms the possibility of a resolution or Epstein's cooperation, but no specific proposal was made.

events.title: Meeting with Assistant's Counsel
events.description: The team met with counsel for one of Epstein's personal assistants. The attorney proffer described the assistant's relationship with Epstein as sexually abusive and touched on her role in scheduling massages.

events.title: Meeting with Victim 'S'
events.description: The team met with a victim ('S') who reported being sexually assaulted by Epstein in Florida, New Mexico, and the Virgin Islands around 2004 when she was 16-17. She stated Epstein raped her multiple times and she lived/traveled with him.

events.title: Meeting with New York Victim
events.description: The team met with another victim introduced to Epstein around 2004 when she was 16. She described multiple visits to his Manhattan residence for sexualized massages that escalated to rape, for which she was paid cash.

events.title: Phone Call with California Attorneys
events.description: The team spoke with attorneys in California representing two additional victims recruited around 2004 to perform 'massages' for Epstein in New York, during which they were sexually assaulted and paid.

events.title: Period of Abuse for Multiple Victims
events.description: Approximate year when multiple victims (including 'S' and the New York model) were recruited, sexually assaulted, and raped by Epstein, often starting at age 16.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team initiated discussions about a potential resolution or cooperation, but without a specific proposal, and prosecutors stated Epstein would need to accept responsibility.
Counsel for one of Epstein's personal assistants described her relationship with Epstein as 'sexually abusive' and indicated she had a role in scheduling massages.
A victim ('S') reported being raped by Epstein on multiple occasions in 2004 when she was 16-17, while living and traveling with him, and her travel was scheduled by assistant NW MM.
Another victim, a 16-year-old model in 2004, reported escalating sexual abuse at Epstein's Manhattan residence culminating in rape, with Epstein knowing her age.

Attorneys in California contacted the office representing two additional victims from 2004, indicating a pattern of recruiting young women for 'massages' that involved sexual assault and cash payment.
